intro: Sclerocroton schmitzii, commonly known as Schmitz's croton, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its rough, woody stems and alternate leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
